validation_warnings: Call date not identified — transcript will be classified as Tier 3 (excluded from evidence)
No Q&A exchanges extracted — this section is critical for communication clarity assessment

speakers.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

key_themes.theme: Organic revenue and subscription growth momentum

supporting_quotes.quote: Verisk delivered organic constant currency revenue growth of 5.5% driven by strong subscription revenue growth of 8.7%. This growth compounded on top of the solid growth delivered last year.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: Subscription revenues, which comprise 84% of our total revenue in the quarter, grew 8.7% on an OCC basis, compounding on the 9.1% OCC growth we delivered in the prior year quarter and consistent with growth levels in the first half of the year.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

supporting_quotes.quote: In the quarter, we experienced an exceptionally low level of severe weather, resulting in a decline in claims assignments across our Xactware system. This and other factors drove transactional revenue declines of 8.8% on an OCC basis.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: Weather events in the 3rd quarter as tracked by NOAA. declined 18% versus last year and were 31% below the five-year average. According to Verisk's own PCS data, third quarter weather event frequency severity declined 30% and 78% respectively on a year-over-year basis. In fact, this third quarter marks the lowest level of storm events in the U.S. since 2017 and 2025 is on track to be the first year since 2015 without a named U.S. hurricane to make landfall so far.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

key_themes.theme: Strategic client engagement and value delivery

supporting_quotes.quote: Our strong subscription growth reflects continued strategic engagement with our clients, and a much improved dialogue on the value that we are delivering, and how we can tailor our solutions to their individual needs.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: What we heard consistently from our clients was, one, that they need more data from us to better integrate across their businesses and functions, and they've demonstrated in new solutions access and surplus that they're willing to increase their data contributions, two, a high interest in the AI enhancements that we've developed using our data sets where they can get immediate benefit without heavy investment, and three, strong support for the efficiency driving multi-partner integrations that we provide in our property estimating solutions and specialty business, and that we are developing an anti-fraud and extreme event solutions.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: our deployed AI applications have been enthusiastically embraced by our clients. As an example, in XactXpert  where we utilize AI to advise claims professionals in estimate review, we now have over 40 clients using the solution, including six of the top 10 carriers. and year-to-date sales performance is now more than double original quotas.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: And XactXpert can now be further enhanced by Xact AI, adding Gen AI capabilities like photo tagging through a new solution which launched just this month and already has 273 users, including a top 10 carrier.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: we've had very positive reactions to our AI query tools for claim search and SavvyR for regulators, with about half of our 30 SavvyR states signed on, allowing our clients to more easily interrogate our data through natural language interfaces.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: it's all about the data. AI relies on high quality and usable data to train the models, and I can say with confidence that Verisk's content, which includes data, language, analytics, and models, is built upon proprietary data that is not publicly available and is structured, cleansed, vetted, and designed by us to take advantage of the power of AI.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: Our investments in Core Lines reimagined and the success we've had as demonstrated by our subscription growth is the clearest evidence that our curated datasets remain the fuel that powers insurance analytics. While it is still early, we are experiencing increased usage of our content as the introduction of AI tools in certain of our solutions is making it easier for our clients to interact with, driving value for our clients.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: we continue to grow the number of contributors to our existing data sets, onboarding 10 new statistical data contributors so far in 2025.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: Verisk's clients are also actively supporting our new initiatives to build greenfield contributory data sets across anti-fraud and for the excess and surplus lines. Specifically, our new digital media forensics currently has 106 contributors, including five of the top 10 carriers, representing over 600 million digital images.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: With E&S, insurers are responding positively to our initiative to collect data for this growing market. We began this initiative less than a year ago and have already received commitments and actual data from several companies representing billions of dollars of premium.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: Despite the transactional revenue impact, we delivered 8.8% OCC adjusted EBITDA growth with expanded EBITDA margin of 55.8%.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: total adjusted EBITDA margins, which include both organic and inorganic results were 55.8%, up 60 basis points from the prior year. This level of margin expansion reflects our ongoing cost discipline, including the benefits of our global talent optimization, as well as the core leverage from sales growth.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

supporting_quotes.quote: Over the past 5 years, we have delivered over 500 basis points of margin expansion, while self-funding investments in some large scale transformative technology and product upgrades. Including our cloud migration, Corelines reimagined, the ERP implementation and artificial intelligence.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

supporting_quotes.quote: Within Forms, Rules, and Lost Costs, we continue to execute on our innovation agenda through the Reimagine program, which is driving solid price realization in the renewal process across all client tiers. In the 3rd quarter, we launched 3 new modules as the latest demonstration of the increased value we're delivering to clients and the industry.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

supporting_quotes.quote: our new Indication Center delivers key rating elements to our clients 2 months sooner than our traditional loss cost review process. This allows insurers to begin responsive rate action sooner and more confidently when incorporating various data into their pricing and underwriting management.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

supporting_quotes.quote: We remain on track to deliver all 20 planned reimagined releases in 2025. reinforcing our commitment to innovation and execution discipline.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

supporting_quotes.quote: FTC approval of the transaction has been delayed. We have received a second request for information, and we continue to have productive engagement with the FTC, working within the conditions of the federal government shutdown. Consequently, we do not expect to realize any material benefit from the pending transaction in 2025 and have removed any operating results from our 2025 guidance.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: We are proactively engaged with the FTC and continue to believe in the strategic and financial merits of the transaction.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: Concretely, our elevated strategic engagement is leading to more pipeline opportunities, and in fact 2025 is on track to be our strongest sales year yet, with sales teams across Verisk exceeding an ambitious quota for the second straight year.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Lee Shavel

supporting_quotes.quote: As discussed last quarter, we continue to see softness in our personal lines auto business relating to competitive pressures. In addition, we are experiencing tougher comparisons on certain non-rate action deals as carriers have been more successful achieving greater rate adequacy.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

supporting_quotes.quote: On a reported basis, net cash from operating activities increased 36% to $404 million, while free cash flow rose 40% to $336 million. This increase was driven primarily by an improvement in the timing of collections, as well as lower cash taxes paid due to changes in the tax code associated with the treatment of research and development costs.
supporting_quotes.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
supporting_quotes.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

financial_metrics_cited.speaker: Lee Shavel

financial_metrics_cited.context: Net income was $226 million, a 2.5% increase versus the prior year.

financial_metrics_cited.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

financial_metrics_cited.context: While diluted GAAP earnings per share were $1.61, up 5% versus the prior year.
financial_metrics_cited.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
financial_metrics_cited.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

financial_metrics_cited.context: In the 3rd quarter, OCC revenues grew 5.5%. With growth of 5.8% in underwriting and 5% in claims.
financial_metrics_cited.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
financial_metrics_cited.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

financial_metrics_cited.metric: Impact of temporary factors on OCC revenue growth
financial_metrics_cited.context: We did experience 2 temporary factors that impacted growth in the quarter. Namely 1st, a historically low level of weather activity. And therefore claims volumes that were significantly lower than our estimate of a typical year. And 2, the reduction in a government contract, which we had spoken to you about previously. Together, those factors combine for an impact of approximately 1% to overall Verisk OCC revenue growth in the quarter.
financial_metrics_cited.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
financial_metrics_cited.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: we expect consolidated revenue to be in the range of 3.05 billion to $3.08 billion.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: We expect adjusted EBITDA to be in the range of 1.69 to $1.72 billion.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: And adjusted EBITDA margins to remain in the 55 to 55.8% range.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: We now expect net interest expense to be in the range of 165 to $185 million.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: From a tax perspective, we are still expecting to be in the range of 23 to 25%.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: Taken all together, we continue to expect diluted adjusted earnings per share in the range of $6.80 to $7.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: We do not expect to realize any material financial benefit from the pending transaction in 2025. And have therefore removed any operating results from our 2025 guidance.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: As we look ahead to the fourth quarter, we remind you that we do have another very tough weather comparison, as last year we saw enough lift in revenue from Hurricane Ian and Milton.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: We view these factors as temporary and continue to have confidence in our ability to deliver results in line with our long-term targets for this year, for 2026, and beyond.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

guidance_and_outlook.verbatim_language: We continue to believe that our tax rate will fall in the 23 to 25% range for the full year.
guidance_and_outlook.speaker: Elizabeth Mann
guidance_and_outlook.role: Chief Financial Officer and Interim Head of Claims

confidence_language: We are excited about the growth opportunities ahead and have confidence in delivering on our long-term strategy and driving value creation for shareholders.

the underlying strength and resilience of our business

deflection_or_reframing: Despite the transactional revenue impact, we delivered 8.8% OCC adjusted EBITDA growth with expanded EBITDA margin of 55.8%.

Beneath the near-term light-weather impacts reflected in our current quarter's results is clear and unmistakable evidence that our strategic engagement initiatives, enhanced go-to-market strategy, and product invention, including AI, are enhancing the value of our data and expanding our growth opportunities.
The clearest demonstration of the health of our business is the growth of our subscription revenues.

I think when we are talking about softer or hard markets, that really is going to play out in the subscription growth from a value perspective, whereas clearly within this quarter, you know, that differentiation, that six and a half, is primarily transactionally driven.
